title: UX Designer
description: Design products that provide meaningful and relevant experiences to users. This involves the design of the entire process of acquiring and integrating the product, including aspects of branding, design, usability and function.
overview: UX (User Experience) Design is a process aimed at increasing user satisfaction with a product by improving the usability, accessibility, and pleasure provided in the interaction with the product. This roadmap will guide you from understanding the basics of human-computer interaction to mastering advanced prototyping and research techniques.
careerScope: UX Designers are in high demand across all sectors as companies realize the value of good design. Career paths include UI/UX Designer, Product Designer, UX Researcher, and UX Strategist.

beginner.name: Design Thinking
beginner.desc: Understand the 5 stages: Empathize, Define, Ideate, Prototype, Test.

beginner.name: Figma Fundamentals
beginner.desc: Master the industry-standard tool for interface design and prototyping.

beginner.name: Wireframing Basics
beginner.desc: Learn to create low-fidelity layouts to structure content effectively.

beginner.name: Color Theory & Typography
beginner.desc: Understand how color and type influence user perception and readability.

intermediate.name: Prototyping & Micro-interactions
intermediate.desc: Create interactive prototypes that simulate the final product experience.

intermediate.name: User Research Methods
intermediate.desc: Conduct user interviews, surveys, and create personas to understand user needs.

intermediate.name: Responsive Design
intermediate.desc: Design interfaces that adapt seamlessly to different screen sizes and devices.

intermediate.name: UI Design Patterns
intermediate.desc: Learn common interface patterns for navigation, forms, and lists.

advanced.name: Design Systems
advanced.desc: Build and maintain a library of reusable components and guidelines for consistency.

advanced.name: Accessibility (WCAG)
advanced.desc: Ensure your designs are usable by people with diverse abilities.

advanced.name: Usability Testing & Analytics
advanced.desc: Validate designs with real users and use data to iterate and improve.

advanced.name: UX Strategy & Leadership
advanced.desc: Align design goals with business objectives and lead design teams.

projects.title: Product Landing Page
projects.problemStatement: A local coffee shop needs a website to showcase their menu and location, but they have no online presence.
projects.description: Design a clean, responsive landing page for 'Brew & Bean', a fictional local coffee shop. Focus on visual hierarchy and clear calls-to-action.
implementationPlan: Create a mood board for inspiration
Translate wireframes to high-fidelity in Figma
Create a simple desktop and mobile view
guide: Start by defining the brand colors (e.g., warm browns and creams).
Use a 12-column grid for the desktop layout.
Ensure the 'Visit Us' button is prominent.

projects.title: Task Manager App
projects.problemStatement: Users struggle to organize their daily tasks and often feel overwhelmed by complex productivity apps.
projects.description: Design a mobile app interface for a simple, gesture-based task manager. Focus on interaction design and ease of use.
learningOutcomes: Creating interactive prototypes with smart animate
implementationPlan: Define user flows (Add task, Complete task, Delete task)
Design screens for Home, Task Details, and Settings
Prototype the interactions (Swipe to delete, Tap to complete)
guide: Is usability your top priority? Keep the interface clutter-free.
Use swipe gestures for quick actions.
Add a satisfying animation when a task is completed.

projects.title: E-commerce Checkout Flow
projects.problemStatement: Cart abandonment rates are high due to a confusing / long checkout process.
projects.description: Redesign the checkout flow for an online fashion retailer to minimize friction and increase conversion rates.
implementationPlan: Map out the ideal user journey
Design the steps: Cart -> Shipping -> Payment -> Confirmation
Conduct a small usability test with friends/peers
projects.deploymentStrategy: Present as a case study with 'Before' and 'After' metrics.
guide: Provide real-time validation for form fields.

projects.title: Travel Buddy Case Study
projects.problemStatement: Solo travelers often feel unsafe and lonely but struggle to find reliable companions or safe itineraries.
projects.description: End-to-end product design for 'Travel Buddy', an app connecting solo travelers. You will cover research, ideation, design, and testing.
learningOutcomes: Balancing user needs with business goals
implementationPlan: Phase 2: Define. Create User Personas and Journey Maps.
Phase 3: Develop. Sketch solutions and create mid-fi wireframes.
Phase 4: Deliver. High-fidelity prototype and a polished case study presentation.
projects.deploymentStrategy: Publish on Behance/Dribbble and your personal portfolio.
projects.securityConsiderations: Consider user verification and privacy features for safety.
commonPitfalls: Designing for yourself instead of the user
